CdrDoc.CdrDocXml:
<?xml version="1.0"?> <!-- ================================================================ $Id: CDR0000524068.xml,v 1.3 2006-11-30 20:42:04 venglisc Exp $
Filter to strip Insertion/Deletion markup from a document so that test data within this markup can be passed to the vendor output filter set. Volker Englisch, 2006-11-30.
$Log: not supported by cvs2svn $ ================================================================ --> <xsl:transform xmlns:xsl = "http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" xmlns:cdr = "cips.nci.nih.gov/cdr" exclude-result-prefixes = "cdr" version = "1.0">
<xsl:output method = "xml" omit-xml-declaration = "no" encoding = "UTF-8"/> <!-- * ==================================================================== Root element. ==================================================================== --> <xsl:template match = "*"> <xsl:copy> <xsl:apply-templates mode = "copy"/> </xsl:copy> </xsl:template>
<!-- ====================================================================== Remove the Insertion/Deletion markup tags and pretend they had never been entered. ====================================================================== --> <xsl:template match = "Insertion | Deletion"> <xsl:apply-templates/> </xsl:template>
<!-- ====================================================================== Template rule used to do XML to XML transformations which copies any attribute node, or node that is child of of something ===================================================================== --> <xsl:template match = "@*" mode = "copy"> <xsl:copy/> </xsl:template>
<xsl:template match = "*" mode = "copy"> <xsl:element name = "{name()}"> <xsl:apply-templates select = "@*" mode = "copy"/> <xsl:apply-templates mode = "copy"/> </xsl:element> </xsl:template> </xsl:transform>
